meanings.definition: Capable of being extended or shortened like a telescope.
meanings.sent1: The toy had a telescopic arm that could stretch out and retract easily.
meanings.sent2: The firefighter used a telescopic ladder to reach the top of the building.
meanings.sent3: The telescopic pen was so long when extended that it looked like a magic wand.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was like a telescopic antenna, able to expand and contract as needed.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's telescopic vision allowed him to spot trouble from miles away.

meanings.definition: Having the ability to see distant objects clearly through a telescope.
meanings.sent1: The astronomer's telescopic gaze revealed a new star in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The tourist enjoyed the telescopic view of the mountains from the observatory.
meanings.sent3: The detective's telescopic eyes spotted the hidden clue in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like a telescopic lens, capturing every detail of the scene.
meanings.sent5: The spy's telescopic binoculars allowed him to monitor the target without being noticed.
